isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9100i and 9200i DAY CAB MODELS after JANUARY 1997

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 9100 i and 9200 i DAY CAB MODELS after JANUARY 1997

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 9100 i and 9200 i day cab models after January 1997 contains one air spring (bag) (Item 7), two shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 10). The air suspension assembly (Figure 110) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance

The following components - air line (to air spring) (Item 16), hex nipple fitting (Item 14), elbow fitting (Item 15), air spring (bag) (Item 7), height control valve (Item 10), shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9) and lateral control rod (Item 6) - should be checked at the time the truck is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 10), air spring (bag) (Item 7) and shock absorbers (Items 8 and 9) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 110) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 10, Figure 110) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 111 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect connector (Item 7) and air line (supply) (Item 1) from elbow fitting in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Loosen compression nut (Item 8) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 2) from elbow fitting in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3).

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 4) from threaded ball pivot by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve arm (Item 5).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 18 and 19) and remove height control valve (Item 10) from mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Remove two hex flanged head bolts and hex flanged lock nuts (Items 21 and 24) at the top of shock absorber (Item 8).
Remove two hex flanged head bolts and hex flanged lock nuts (Items 22 and 24) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 8).
Remove shock absorber (Item 8) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Remove two hex flanged head bolts and hex flanged lock nuts (Items 21 and 24) at the top of shock absorber (Item 9).
Remove hex lock nut (Item 27) and shock washer (Item 4) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 9).
Remove shock absorber (Item 9) with shock washers (Item 4) and shock spacer limiter (Item 5) from shock mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure air system is drained and be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Loosen compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 15) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 16) from elbow fitting at top of air spring (bag) (Item 7).
Remove elbow fitting (Item 15) from hex nipple fitting (Item 14) at top of air spring (bag) (Item 7).
Remove hex nipple fitting (Item 14) from top of air spring (bag) (Item 7).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 25) from the top of air spring (bag) (Item 7) at cab mounting plate (Item 1).
Remove machine screw (Item 26) from the bottom of air spring (bag) (Item 7) under crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).
Slide air spring (bag) (Item 7) from between cab mounting plate (Item 1) and crossmember mounting plate (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 110 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 6) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 29) and hex lock nut (Item 30) from mounting bracket of crossmember mounting plate (Item 2) and lateral control rod (Item 6).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 29) and hex lock nut (Item 30) from cab mounting plate (Item 1) and lateral control rod (Item 6) and remove lateral control rod.
